attributes.action: Make it so the UK people can vote if there MPs get payrise in uncertain climates
attributes.additional_details:
To let people have a say in parliament matters on a local vote on money matters in uncertain times

So the money can go to local community support and major issues affecting the community
attributes.background: Put a public vote in place so the people in the UK vote if there local MP gets a pay rise in uncertain climates, as the people of the UK feel it my benefit the community instead

rejection.details:
The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for setting MPs' pay. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out more about IPSA here: https://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/
